reviews.title: Great experience!
text: I cannot imagine why this restaurant is rated a high 4??  I went with two friend for lunch on August 14th and found everything great.  Menu, service, ambiance, pricing etc.  I would go back anytime I am in the downtown area!!  5 + from us.

reviews.title: Good overall experience
text: No complaints here. The restaurant is huge. Doesn’t look that way when you see it from the outside but goes back for miles! We actually sat near the front and had a big booth. The food was varied and everybody enjoyed it. The server was friendly and the value for money was good. The timing was a a bit slow but the food was worth it in the end.

reviews.title: Twice as good!!
text: Went to elephant and castle king street for dinner with 20 friends pre phantom of the opera and was shocked to see how big the place was! They seated us at the back of the restaurant and our server was Stephanie (with a trainee who I don’t recall her name).  Food and drink was serviced accurately and timely and it offered us a place for us to talk without ridiculously loud music. We finished our dinner and drinks with plenty of time to get to the theatre!! Since we enjoyed our experience so much, we brought the same group back post show and once again, had a wonderful time!! Stephanie was exemplary on both visits and it was really her that made both visits perfect!! The orders and bills were accurate and the space was absolutely perfect for our friends to get together!! Convenient to both theatres so as subscribers, we will definitely be back!! Thanks so much!!

reviews.title: Nice and good prices
text: Very good food and services. In the center of downtown , $$... good prices for the menu and a beautiful installations.

reviews.title: It’s just average, nothing special.
text: The Elephant & Castle, King Street, Toronto. We went there for the convenience, close to Roy Thompson Hall, etc. The meal was ok, I had steak & mushroom pie, crust was soggy, otherwise it was average. i would not recommend their Fish & Chips. The staff was friendly though, I like the decor.

reviews.title: Servers  needs a lot of training.
text: Since I ordered a bottle of wine, and it was  to finished, It could be taken with me to the hotel.  She said that it was possible, but she would be tapping with a different cork (she put the original cap on the trash).  So far, no problems. Nevertheless, the inserted the cork too deep into the bottle, that I would have difficulties to take it off. I asked help and she was able to take only a little off.  I mentioned that this would not help me. And she told me that, given the hole made, they would not be able to further help.  I ended up leaving the (almost full) bottle of wine to her....  lack of good sense, on my opinion.  It damaged all the experience.

reviews.title: Cold meal for a hefty price
text: The pub is close to the Mirvish Theatres so we thought we would go for lunch.... I understand that they can get busy before a matinee but they dropped off stone cold food and then there was no one to be found to talk to about it....as we could not wait any longer, we ate it... paid a good buck as you are in the entertainment district, but you at least expect to be fed well for the price
Poor service... cold food... very disappointing

reviews.title: Haddock fish and chips - batter tasted burned
text: Haddock fish and chips review - portion fine - fries very good but the batter tasted burned. I believe the oil used was long past it's best before date. You may ask why we didn't complain but the simple fact was that we needed to attend a play at Princess of Whales.

reviews.title: Great find
text: I was in town on business- and walked down King Street from the Hilton Toronto- looking for a place to grab a casual bite and watch the hockey.
I found this pub.
It was busy but not packed. It is a fairly large place! I was seated quickly and service was efficient.
I ordered the butter chicken poutine- and it was good. There was SO MUCH FOOD.
There are a lot of small tvs around, so you can see fairly well from just about anywhere.
It was not overly rowdy, nor was it expensive. I would definitely go back if given the opportunity.
Definitely recommend.

reviews.title: Disappointing visit
text: Large selection of beers on tap, looks like an English style pub but clearly the name and decor are the only similarity. Guinness is the only beer close to home. Food was mediocre at best, I ordered full English breakfast, beans were dried paste, two of my eggs came burst on the plate, sausage was dried out and bacon tasted like it had been warmed several times in old grease. Two of us had home fries delivered on separate plates and the third had them on his plate with everything else, strange😡

reviews.title: Not to be missed
text: One of the best places to eat. We went twice. The service was quick and everybody was very friendly. Excellent fish and chips!

reviews.title: Cheers!
text: Good place for drinks. Bartenders were very friendly and provided great service. Stopped in on a Saturday night with my girlfriend to enjoy a few drinks and watch some soccer while on our trip in Toronto. We both liked the huge bar, definitely worth checking out when visiting the city.

reviews.title: Nice
text: Had beer and wings at this pub which is just around the corner from our hotel.  Good atmosphere.  Lots of TV's.  Good service

reviews.title: Good sandwiches and wraps
text: Great food and all kinds of beers in a casual yet nice atmosphre. Good staff and alot of screens to view sports

reviews.title: Great Food, Great Service
text: We had dinner at the restaurant before attending a show in the area. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. We ordered some staple pub food - chicken pot pie, meat loaf, etc. and they were great!! Would definitely come back.

reviews.title: after conference drinks
text: Our group came to the Elephant and Castle after a conference in Toronto.  The food was tasty and the beer was cold.  Pretty much all you can ask for from a pub.  The service was good, although the hostess could learn how to smile...she seemed a little flustered!

reviews.title: Christmas party
text: Had a our christmas party here. Over 50 atteneded. There  are many English dishes to chose from but we had pre set finger food ofr the party. Shrimp, chicken wings, pretzal bread, fried pickles and more. We were stuffed and all the food was great. We our going back for the dinner!!  Give this place a visit, you won't regret it.

reviews.title: Kinda expected for an old franchise
text: We did have a VERY nice waitress ..... kinda hard to say anything else about the place.
Place is well .... worn. Is there an upgrade in the works cause the chair I was sitting in constantly squeeked.

It was 1pm amnd went to the bar to checkout the drafts (mainly to get outta a squeeky chair) where i was warmly great a "What"? I informed him I was seated in the dining room and was mearly looking at the taps so I didn't bother the waitress too much. Apparently he didn't care cause he just walked away.
Did I say the waitress was nice?
Food has not changed since the late '80s when I had it in Edmonton. Price has definitely changed. Felt not worth a $60 lunch for old food

reviews.title: Trendy
text: We popped in here for a beer and a bite.  Quite trendy and very busy.   The atmosphere was great and so was the service staff.  Beer nice and cold.  I had a bake onion soup and it was delicious.  No complaints.  Check it out.

reviews.title: Great food and atmosphere!
text: We were a group of 5 and ordered wine and a range of entrees to try and the food here is amazing!  Try the jalapeno mac n' cheese, or the linguini or the fish and chips.   They are all great.   For dessert, the big brownie is the best for sharing, it's couple of layers of brownie with vanilla ice-cream, absolutely delicious and filling.

reviews.title: Fantastic food and service- let yourself be tempted!
text: Treat yourself to the stuffed Yorkshire pudding, a house favourite which you need to order quickly or it will be sold out! Loved the recommendation by my waiter and will go back prior to the next show I go to see in TO's entertainment district.

reviews.title: Lunch End Oct 2016
text: Had turkey and bacon sandwich with fries, good, with beer and cider. Had free wi-fi easy to log on, staff very helpful.

reviews.title: Good food and good atmosphere
text: We were a group of 7 that included two boys. Good selection of beer. The boys enjoyed the chicken fingers and fries. One adult enjoyed her salad and another enjoyed his meatloaf with bacon. Three of us had the club sandwich with poutine which we enjoyed. We will return.

reviews.title: Friendly staff
text: The first place we went to on arriving in Canada. The staff were friendly and helpful. I tried the Canadian speciality, 'poutine' French fries with cheese curds and gravy, surprisingly nice!

reviews.title: OK Place to Eat
text: Had lunch at this location was expecting a lot more quality? The food was OK and would equate the quality to more of a roadhouse cuisine than anything else. The service was sporadic at best and could be friendlier. Ordered the Reuben sandwich, which was very good, and my companion ordered the salad but complained there was way too much dressing on it. They should serve the dressing on the side and let the patron add what they want. The is a limited selection of beers and I would have thought that they would have a lot more Ontario craft beers.

reviews.title: Pub Meal in Downtown Toronto
text: We visited the Elephant and Castle Pub on 2 occasions during our week long visit to the city of Toronto.
The staff are welcoming and the service and food is good.
It's a busy venue which has a great buzz and captures the mood of Yonge Street.

reviews.title: Much better after renovations
text: I've been coming here for years. I had stopped coming for about two years because it just wasn't good anymore. The menu wasn't good, the ingredients were sub-par, and the prices had gone up a lot. Then the owners or management changed hands, the restaurant was renovated, and the menu was changed up. It's much better now. The inside isn't dreary anymore, the service is quick, the ingredients don't taste like they came out of Lake Ontario, and the prices are average. I've come back now that things have changed. Be sure to try the jalapeño mac and cheese!

reviews.title: Elephant and Castle - Poor Beer Selection
text: Hoped to enjoy a beer after the TSO concert so we when into the Elephant and Castle Pub.
The bartender had to take two attempts to make my wife's gin and tonic. I tried a series of tastes of beers on tap and settled for the Kelly Pale Ale which I found close to unsinkable.
perhaps the Maple leaf fan will drink almost everything while watching the game in this sports bar!

reviews.title: Wonderful place to have a meal
text: We went to this restaurant prior to attending a performance in the entertainment district. We really enjoyed our meal and the service from the staff. We also found the prices reasonable.

reviews.title: Good for a Quick Meal before a Show
text: Everything was great. The location is central to most of downtown Toronto. You could wish for more menu or draft beer variety, but I liked what they had. The service was efficient without feeling pushy.

reviews.title: Trying to be English
text: A decent pub with good service. It tries to be British by serving Bass and Boddingtons, sadly those are things that nobody in England has ordered in a decade but top marks for trying. “Imports” like Stella are expensive but local beers are very reasonable.

reviews.title: Great Service
text: We visited this resteraunt before going to see a show. Although very busy we had very quick service and the waitress was so helpful and friendly. The food was excellent.
Would recommend this resteraunt.

reviews.title: Holiday
text: We visited here twice, once just for a drink then again for tea before going to the theatre. Food and service great. Portion sizes not massive but very nice.

reviews.title: Great comfort food.
text: Before going to the Royal Alex theater 3 friends of mine and I dined there. We had reservations and our table was giving right on time, service was excellent and the food was very good. For a pub the they had great selection of food. This place has a front patio also facing the street, and inside is enormous. Since it’s only 3 doors down from the Royal Alex most people that go to the theater eat there before going to see their show. Totally recommend it.

reviews.title: Really enjoyed
text: I went to Elephant and Castle yesterday for lunch prior to a Mirvish show. First of all, Mirvish card holders get a discount which is awesome (that's why we went). It was truly exceptional. My mother had the Butternut Squash soup and she could not stop raving about it. I had the Cheesesteak and it was probably the best cheesesteak I have ever had in my life. The bread was delicious, the steak was delicious, and all of the vegetables in it were delicious. I would certainly get it again. Another person in our party had the chicken fingers. The breading was light and fluffy and the fries were delicious. Service was quick and friendly. I look forward to coming back again!
They had a deal on mimosas and cesaers as well ($5 for bottomless I think?).

reviews.title: Exceptional pub fare
text: Met a friend for lunch there and had great food.  I ordered the chicken mandarin salad which was lovely.  She had fish tacos which were good but got one that tasted "fishy" so did not eat it all.  Servers were excellent and a definite high point at the restaurant. Happy to see the inside was wheelchair accessible although the elevator needed to accommodate entering the restaurant won't be ready until Sept some time.

reviews.title: Mediocre
text: Calamari looks like the end bits that have been floating around in the fryer.  Cajun ceaser wrap left something to be desired.  Drinks were great.  Prices are reasonable. The space is beautiful and clean but the set up doesn't feel comfortable enough to stay for long.

reviews.title: Buzzy Beer and Burger Bar
text: Just took a few beers in the Elephant and Castle in Kings Street.  Buzzy city bar which empties around 9.  Usual fast food menu and quite a few beers on tap including some US dark beers.  Friendly bar staff and quick service.

reviews.title: Cool bar
text: Good range of beer and good service. Good location and perfect for dinner or a beer between all the tourist stuff. Some genuine British staff that were really nice - Ruth.

reviews.title: After Matinee delight
text: 2nd visit with a show. Not a dull dish! Place crowded pretty and past shows. Service excellent and friendly.  Food come in proper order and timeframe. The Sheppard pie was tasty and rich while Steak and Mushroom cauldron was big and reminded me of good days in London that are long gone. Desert was nice but we were unable to stuff the cheese cake too.
